tags: i've never thought about crossover brotps before but i love them tysm for asking
summary: BroTP Pike & jester
question: BroTP Pike & jester
answer:
who steals french fries off the other’s plate

Jester. She thinks she’s sneaky but really Pike bought extra fries knowing Jester would steal half of them

who jokingly moves in for the kiss when someone asks if they’re a couple

Jester, Pike usually goes for the hand-around-the-waist

who has to bust or bail the other out of jail

Pike

who gives the other advice/comfort about dating issues

Jester doesn’t ask for advice, but Pike always knows when she needs it

who shamelessly cheats at games by reaching over to cover the other’s eyes

Jester

who immediately calls dibs on the top bunk

Also Jester

who starts and who wins the pillow fights

Jester starts them, Pike wins them

who says “your pants would look better on their floor” to the other’s potential crush

Jester. Pike blushed so hard she had to excuse herself to get some air

summary:
(I tried to post this a minute ago and it doesn't appear to have gone. I'll delete if duplicate)
One of my to-do list items...
body:
(I tried to post this a minute ago and it doesn’t appear to have gone. I’ll delete if duplicate)

One of my to-do list items today was to perform surgery on my lil Frumpkin plush and put a neodymium magnet in his tummy. I’m also sewing a magnet into the shoulder of Caleb’s coat, and hiding one in his wig. This way, I’ll be able to stick my magic cat to me as I walk around!

I’m also planning to make some little magnet packs for my friends to hide on their costumes as they make m9 cosplays so my familiar can go visit other party members.

But for now he’s stuck to my fridge… Frumpkin the Fey King, Guardian of Snacks!

tags: tumblr why do you keep messing with the formatting so bad
summary: Brotp ask thing: Caleb & Beau
question: Brotp ask thing: Caleb & Beau
answer:
who steals french fries off the other’s plate

Caleb, but only when Beau’s not looking


who jokingly moves in for the kiss when someone asks if they’re a couple

Beau tried this exactly once, and Caleb was so thrown off by it that they silently agreed to never try that again


who has to bust or bail the other out of jail

Caleb 100%


who gives the other advice/comfort about dating issues

Usually it’s Caleb, and the advice is usually along the lines of “no really she’s into you just ask her out”


who shamelessly cheats at games by reaching over to cover the other’s eyes

Mostly Beau, sometimes Caleb


who immediately calls dibs on the top bunk

Beau. Caleb tries, but by the time he gets the words out Beau has already parkoured her way to the top bunk


who starts and who wins the pillow fights

Beau starts them, and usually wins them unless it’s a ranged pillow fight, which Caleb always wins


who says “your pants would look better on their floor” to the other’s potential crush

Beau

summary: So this is super out of left field, but I am considering getting a commission for a new thumbnail for my social media accounts!...
body:
So this is super out of left field, but I am considering getting a commission for a new thumbnail for my social media accounts! I don't just like using a super old headshot of me on Twitter, and I've used this Laura Bailey Icon for about 1 year now, and I think it would come off as super professional and cool to get some kinda cartoony caricature of me like a lot of other YT channels have!

So, does anyone have any recommendations for artists who do this kind of work looking for commissions? I can’t go super expensive, but maybe someone within the Critical Role community who can do a cartoon version of me in some way? I can headshots and guidelines on how I want it to look!

If anyone knows anybody who is willing to do this for moderate pay, please let me know!

summary: I love in that last Talks Machina Laura talks about how she needs to stop going into hand to hand combat situations because it...
body: I love in that last Talks Machina Laura talks about how she needs to stop going into hand to hand combat situations because it doesn’t do very well.  So what happens the next Critical Role?  She goes into a fighting ring with Beau against a massive Ogre that she comes barely to his knee and a mysterious drow.

don't take this as me saying she's not a good player ok? thank youu
summary: Listen, Marisha is doing an AMAZING job with Beau. Like y’all know me, Beau is my favorite PC, my baby, I love her to a...
body: Listen, Marisha is doing an AMAZING job with Beau. Like y’all know me, Beau is my favorite PC, my baby, I love her to a fault…HOWEVER…there are times,  when Marisha’s straightness is just painfully obvious and it’s in those moments that she just brushes off when the Nein (first Nott, now Jester) insinuate the possibility of Beau possessing any sort of het tendencies. Like for real, I do not know ANY out lesbian who’d let that shit slide. NOT ONE.

mini fics / my writing / tags list

summary:
Once they finally make it to the private refuge of their shared
room, Beau rounds on her, apparently no longer able to hold her...
body:
Once they finally make it to the private refuge of their shared room, Beau rounds on her, apparently no longer able to hold her silence.

“You can’t just use me to make some boy you like jealous. That—that’s really fucking shitty, Jes.”

“Okay, first of all,” says Jester, grabbing Beau’s elbow to stop her from storming out to the bar, “it’s not ‘some boy I like,’ it’s fucking… it’s just Fjord, okay? And second of all, I thought friends helped each other with this kind of stuff. Aren’t you supposed to be, you know, my wingman or something?”

“Sure, Jessie,” she says scathingly, “I’m just your lesbian plaything for you to flirt with and touch and deploy to make dudes pay attention to you. That’s a real classic.”

Jester lets go of her elbow as if she’s been burned. “What—what the fuck, Beau, that’s not fair.”

“Isn’t it?”

“No! You know I don’t think of you that way, you asshole.” Her hurt quickly melts into indignation, anger. “And don’t pretend that you don’t do the exact same thing.”

“What’s that supposed to mean?” Beau says hotly, but all of a sudden she won’t quite look Jester in the eye.

“I know you got super happy that time Yasha asked me if you and I were, like, a thing.” Jester folds her arms, takes a step closer to her, but Beau doesn’t flinch or back away. “And then, you, you hug me more when Yasha is around, you’re all cuddly with me and touch-y and nice all while you’re trying so hard to flirt with her.”

Now Beau flinches. “That’s not—” she splutters, scrubs a hand across her face. “Fuck you, Jester, that’s—we’re friends, aren’t we? I thought—best friends. You said.”

They both know she’s dodging the point. Beau and Jester have always been physically affectionate, but it’s true that Beau is normally uncomfortable about initiating, instead letting Jester drag her into bear hugs and cuddle piles unless slaver kidnappers are involved. But when Yasha’s there, when Yasha’s watching, Beau suddenly has no problem draping an arm around Jester’s shoulders, dropping a kiss on her head when she stands to get more beer, holding hands when they’re strolling through the marketplace together. Her gaze trained on the aasimar’s inscrutable face all the while.

“We are. We’re friends.” Jester’s tone is steely, but there’s a tiny hitch of vulnerability there, too. They’re standing so close together now, eyes alight with anger, that Beau can count every freckle spilled across Jester’s face. “Best friends.”

“Best friends,” Beau repeats, and Jester can see the muscle under Beau’s left eye twitching, just a little. She can see the faint, wobbly discoloration of a days-old bruise on her cheek, healed enough to be hard to detect against the warm brown of her skin.

They hold their position, practically nose to nose, barely an inch gapping their bodies. Then finally Beau is the one who darts her gaze away, takes a small step back. Room to breathe.

“Yeah,” says Jester, voice smaller now. “So, like, best friends hug each other and cuddle and hold hands, and we do those things. And we do those things in front of Fjord, and in front of Yasha, so I don’t know why you got all—freaked out this time.”

“You kissed me, Jester.”

“We’ve kissed before.”

“Not on the mouth. Not—not like that.”

(Jester yanking her in by the collar, mouths meeting close-lipped and chaste, until Beau settles a gentle hand on the small of her back and Jester surges forward and suddenly there’s tongue, and the faintest hint of sharp teeth. Then they pull apart, and Beau’s looking at her but Jester’s looking at something above and behind Beau’s shoulder, eyes blazing with a challenge. Her hands rest, still, on Beau’s collarbone.)

They hold their stare-off for another moment before Jester deflates. Neither of them are glaring, now, but they’re standing farther away from each other than they were just a few moments ago, and an inexplicable part of Jester yearns to say, come back. Come back to me.

“I’m really, really sorry,” she says finally. “I should have asked, Beau. That was a super shitty thing to do.”

Just like that, Beau melts. “Thanks,” she mumbles, awkward and uncertain now that they’ve moved from the realm of argument to apology. “But, uh—you’re right. We wingman for each other. I made too big a deal out of it, just—”

“No,” Jester insists, and abruptly she’s reaching out to squeeze the monk’s wrist in an iron grip. “No, you’re right. It was a big deal, and I shouldn’t have done it like that.”

“You had a point, though,” Beau counters. “Friends hug. Friends even kiss. It doesn’t matter.” She eyes her cautiously. Doesn’t pull her arm away. “Because we’re friends. Right, Jes?”

“Friends,” Jester repeats. The word hangs taut in the air between them. She can feel Beau’s rapid heartbeat pulse through the vein of her wrist. “Friends,” she says again. “But I think it matters, still, a little. A lot.”

“Oh,” says Beau. Jester’s grip is starting to hurt, almost.

They hold their breath. Neither move. Caught in stasis.

Beau settles a gentle hand on the small of Jester’s back.
body_abstract:
Once they finally make it to the private refuge of their shared room, Beau rounds on her, apparently no longer able to hold her silence.

“You can’t just use me to make some boy you like jealous. That—that’s really fucking shitty, Jes.”

“Okay, first of all,” says Jester, grabbing Beau’s elbow to stop her from storming out to the bar, “it’s not ‘some boy I like,’ it’s fucking… it’s just Fjord, okay? And second of all, I thought friends helped each other with this kind of stuff. Aren’t you supposed to be, you know, my wingman or something?”

“Sure, Jessie,” she says scathingly, “I’m just your lesbian plaything for you to flirt with and touch and deploy to make dudes pay attention to you. That’s a real classic.”

Jester lets go of her elbow as if she’s been burned. “What—what the fuck, Beau, that’s not fair.”

“Isn’t it?”

“No! You know I don’t think of you that way, you asshole.” Her hurt quickly melts into indignation, anger. “And don’t pretend that you don’t do the exact same thing.”

“What’s that supposed to mean?” Beau says hotly, but all of a sudden she won’t quite look Jester in the eye.

reblog.comment:
Once they finally make it to the private refuge of their shared room, Beau rounds on her, apparently no longer able to hold her silence.

“You can’t just use me to make some boy you like jealous. That—that’s really fucking shitty, Jes.”

“Okay, first of all,” says Jester, grabbing Beau’s elbow to stop her from storming out to the bar, “it’s not ‘some boy I like,’ it’s fucking… it’s just Fjord, okay? And second of all, I thought friends helped each other with this kind of stuff. Aren’t you supposed to be, you know, my wingman or something?”

“Sure, Jessie,” she says scathingly, “I’m just your lesbian plaything for you to flirt with and touch and deploy to make dudes pay attention to you. That’s a real classic.”

Jester lets go of her elbow as if she’s been burned. “What—what the fuck, Beau, that’s not fair.”

“Isn’t it?”

“No! You know I don’t think of you that way, you asshole.” Her hurt quickly melts into indignation, anger. “And don’t pretend that you don’t do the exact same thing.”

“What’s that supposed to mean?” Beau says hotly, but all of a sudden she won’t quite look Jester in the eye.

[[MORE]]

“I know you got super happy that time Yasha asked me if you and I were, like, a thing.” Jester folds her arms, takes a step closer to her, but Beau doesn’t flinch or back away. “And then, you, you hug me more when Yasha is around, you’re all cuddly with me and touch-y and nice all while you’re trying so hard to flirt with her.”

Now Beau flinches. “That’s not—” she splutters, scrubs a hand across her face. “Fuck you, Jester, that’s—we’re friends, aren’t we? I thought—best friends. You said.”

They both know she’s dodging the point. Beau and Jester have always been physically affectionate, but it’s true that Beau is normally uncomfortable about initiating, instead letting Jester drag her into bear hugs and cuddle piles unless slaver kidnappers are involved. But when Yasha’s there, when Yasha’s watching, Beau suddenly has no problem draping an arm around Jester’s shoulders, dropping a kiss on her head when she stands to get more beer, holding hands when they’re strolling through the marketplace together. Her gaze trained on the aasimar’s inscrutable face all the while.

“We are. We’re friends.” Jester’s tone is steely, but there’s a tiny hitch of vulnerability there, too. They’re standing so close together now, eyes alight with anger, that Beau can count every freckle spilled across Jester’s face. “Best friends.”

“Best friends,” Beau repeats, and Jester can see the muscle under Beau’s left eye twitching, just a little. She can see the faint, wobbly discoloration of a days-old bruise on her cheek, healed enough to be hard to detect against the warm brown of her skin.

They hold their position, practically nose to nose, barely an inch gapping their bodies. Then finally Beau is the one who darts her gaze away, takes a small step back. Room to breathe.

“Yeah,” says Jester, voice smaller now. “So, like, best friends hug each other and cuddle and hold hands, and we do those things. And we do those things in front of Fjord, and in front of Yasha, so I don’t know why you got all—freaked out this time.”

“You kissed me, Jester.”

“We’ve kissed before.”

“Not on the mouth. Not—not like that.”

(Jester yanking her in by the collar, mouths meeting close-lipped and chaste, until Beau settles a gentle hand on the small of her back and Jester surges forward and suddenly there’s tongue, and the faintest hint of sharp teeth. Then they pull apart, and Beau’s looking at her but Jester’s looking at something above and behind Beau’s shoulder, eyes blazing with a challenge. Her hands rest, still, on Beau’s collarbone.)

They hold their stare-off for another moment before Jester deflates. Neither of them are glaring, now, but they’re standing farther away from each other than they were just a few moments ago, and an inexplicable part of Jester yearns to say, come back. Come back to me.

“I’m really, really sorry,” she says finally. “I should have asked, Beau. That was a super shitty thing to do.”

Just like that, Beau melts. “Thanks,” she mumbles, awkward and uncertain now that they’ve moved from the realm of argument to apology. “But, uh—you’re right. We wingman for each other. I made too big a deal out of it, just—”

“No,” Jester insists, and abruptly she’s reaching out to squeeze the monk’s wrist in an iron grip. “No, you’re right. It was a big deal, and I shouldn’t have done it like that.”

“You had a point, though,” Beau counters. “Friends hug. Friends even kiss. It doesn’t matter.” She eyes her cautiously. Doesn’t pull her arm away. “Because we’re friends. Right, Jes?”

“Friends,” Jester repeats. The word hangs taut in the air between them. She can feel Beau’s rapid heartbeat pulse through the vein of her wrist. “Friends,” she says again. “But I think it matters, still, a little. A lot.”

“Oh,” says Beau. Jester’s grip is starting to hurt, almost.

They hold their breath. Neither move. Caught in stasis.

Beau settles a gentle hand on the small of Jester’s back.
